What made the experience even better was the lovely ambiance. Soft classic music played in the background, creating a serene and sophisticated atmosphere. To top it off, I loved seeing a few patrons engrossed in friendly games of chess—it gave the place a warm, communal feel. This cafe is a perfect spot for relaxing, savoring great food, and enjoying a little slice of French culture. Highly recommend!

Belgian chocolate coffee is amazing! Croissants with cookie dough and s'mores were fantastic and something I've never tried before! Server was very nice! Highly recommend!!!

Le Pain Quotidien is a gem! The ambiance is warm and inviting, perfect for relaxing or catching up with friends & family. The food is exceptional, with fresh, high-quality ingredients and delicious flavors in every dish. The service is outstanding—attentive, friendly, and efficient. Their coffee and pastries are particularly delightful. Whether you're stopping by for breakfast, lunch, or a casual coffee break, Le Pain Quotidien never disappoints. Highly recommended!

Very good place to have a breakfast ..
Quality is so good .. fresh croissants ..
And most to mention that their cappuccino is perfect ❤️ ..

When the cafe first opened, it went through a rough time of getting the right order and preparing food on time. After months of adjustments, I think the place is pretty solid and the management is trying hard to please everyone. They have good selections of food for everyone from fresh salad bar to entre fancy entree.

This place is really great! I work at the building right next to it so i am a regular.
The employees are always really nice and welcoming.
The cheese omelet with a side of greens is always really good for breakfast or a cheese burrito with potatoes inside. Really good!
For lunch, i recomment the chicken sandwich that they offer with pesto and mozarella cheese. Its delicious, especially when you order a side of the chipotle crema.
Aside from that the morning oatmeal is really good for a lite breakfast and the occasional pineapple juice is to die for!

On top of all of this they usually have your order ready in a timely manner and their prices are really affordable. A must try!

Name: Mary and Robb's Westwood Cafe an American diner
Address: 1455 Westwood Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90024, USA
Combined Review Text:
Hit it out of the park!   Food was delicious, had the breakfast burrito, with bacon.  Had a nice balance of flavors and a great crisp to each bite.  The burrito had just a flair of spice, which went well with it.   Sat at the bar, and my coffee cup never got more than half empty.  10 out of 10 would return!

Awesome place that has been around since the 50's. Food is good, and the place is a vibe. Shout-out to the super attentive waitress girl Gemma, you're awesome!

Old time coffee shop with a full menu. Please come here so this place stays open. Have an omelette. Or a burger. Great service. Homey atmosphere. You can on Mary and Robb's being the same every time, and we like it that way!

A delicious diner in Westwood. It’s been open since 1967, and has a lot of history associated with it. It’s very large on the inside with many different seating options. Inside is designed like a traditional retro diner, which I personally love. We were able to be seated right when we arrived and service was very fast. They don’t have a dedicated parking lot so it will be metered street parking.

They have a very large menu filled with all the American diner classics. For my first time I chose the Chili Omelette Supreme and honestly really loved it. It was a very large omelette filled with a very meaty chili and it really hit the spot. The avocado on top was a great addition. We also tried the traditional breakfast, and the pancakes were especially good.

Overall a really solid diner option in a nice part of town. I would recommend to any breakfast fan and I plan to be back in the future to try more dishes.

Looking for a dine in place with breakfast pancakes. Found this place and very happy.

Quality food along with great attentive service. Restaurant was able to make my Blueberry pancakes 🥞 delicious.

The mimosas are on point 👌🏼.

The restaurant is near Westwood and Ohio. South of Wilshire.

Bought a bottle to go. Coffee ☕ 🍻

Name: Ministry of Coffee
Address: 1010 Glendon Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90024, USA
Combined Review Text:
Great breakfast place. My croissant egg sandwich was great. Eggs were perfect not dry or over cooked. Solid serving of avocado. Delicious saffron mayo. My coffee was very good too. Great quality pastries and desserts. Definitely recommend this place!

Peaceful and spacious, especially on a Sunday morning when it wasn’t busy at all. There’s plenty of room both indoors and outdoors, and the menu offers a wide variety of options. I genuinely enjoyed my visit, and it made for a perfect start to the day, especially paired with my morning read.

Such a lovely coffee shops with good food options. It is located at Westwood by UCLA. After a certain time finding a table becomes  a challenge. Parking in the area is also difficult. There is a close by parking garage.
The coffee, ambiance and food selections are all good.

Update: the food and service continue to be really good. We tried different breakfast items this time. Both were fresh and tasty

I was in LA few weeks ago for twelve days and this is on of my favorite spot for sure. Live the location in Westwood in the UCLA area. Very quiet and relaxing area in the huge LA, I loved walking there and enjoying breakfast. The vibes are great with so many your people around that took me back the university time! Very good coffee and food in general, croissants, sandwiches, toasts etc. Staff is extremely kind and welcoming and it was a pleasure spending time there working and relaxing a bit. I f you need groceries the location is perfect since at few steps there are Target and Trader Joe’s! Strongly recommended!

I only try their coffee there, but it’s so cute. I love the yellow colors and the lattes are pretty good.

The paninis are quite tasty, but wait times can be absurd (20+ minutes).

Love the big portions and their soup of the day is always great. Broccoli cheddar and tomato bisque are my favs 🍀💕

Small portions for a high price. What you get is pretty good though.

Nice coffee and i like the pesto turkey panini 🦃️

Name: Parakeet Cafe - Beverly Hills
Address: 206 S Beverly Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
Combined Review Text:
The food is amazing and everyone at the restaurant has been so kind and inviting. The gluten free options are better than I’ve had anywhere else. Great flavor profiles, delicious and health focused.

This cafe will fool you coming in, the atmosphere is not wow, nor is the service level and interaction. But wait till you get to the good part, the food is seriously good, fresh and full of taste.
The French Omelette sandwich is a great combination of fresh greens, eggs and the rest of delicious amenities.
The Best burger ever is actually one of the best burgers ever 😁, juicy, great sauce and perfect caramelized onions.
I think the grilled chicken sandwich was the least of our favorites.
To end with, the salmon toast was a very refreshing sandwich, the salmon is beetroot flavored salmon,, a nice twist.
I think these guys have really worked on the details and food, so takeaways should be on fire.
Ohh and the coffees were great 👍.

Just unlocked a new fave bfast dish! It was my first time trying the Shakshuka and it was amazing. The flavors of the sauce were so good and I loved the toast. It was a bit spicy but nothing I couldn’t handle with some water (take it from someone who has no tolerance to spicy food). I also had the matcha and it was good but not memorable.

Food was great but what was really amazing was their freshly brew drip coffee- I was curious which brand of beans they used. Very lovely atmosphere as well.

Healthy food with a creative twist! I would never have thought to have chili sauce on my eggs! Highly recommend the All I Avo Wanted. If you are wanting to have unique flavors, try that dish!

Name: Pascal on Beverly
Address: 200 S Beverly Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
Combined Review Text:
Beverly Hills has so many cute cafes, and I'm glad we tried this place out! We ended up sitting outside and the food and drinks were delivered to our table. Cute interior but they didn't have any empty tables. It was kind of cold outside but luckily we brought jackets, no warmers available.

I got the sun dried tomatoes quiche, which was very crisp and flavorful. My friends got the farmers omelette breakfast sandwich, and open face avocado toast- and they enjoyed it.

Coffee was good of course.

Great atmosphere. Workers are friendly. Love the outdoor seating.

Coffee was pretty good. We had a baguette with butter and jam and we really enjoyed it!

We will be back

A cute sweet cafe at the corner, music isn’t too loud and the decor is simple and tidy. Beautiful desserts (didn’t taste them) and good coffee.

Went here for my birthday and LOVED IT! The French Onion Soup was absolutely yummy. So big I shared it with my sister. The Filet Mignon was cooked perfectly (Rare Plus) and practically melted in my mouth. The Pannacotta Dessert was absolutely yummy! Just the right amount of sweetness. The ambiance was great with conversations at normal pitch. Our waitress was kind, attentive and fabulous. I'm definitely coming back here!!

Service here is amazing, people are very nice, they got so many breakfast\brunch and lunch options. Good variety of bakeries, pies, cakes and coffee as well.
Recommended

Name: Pat's Cafe

Really great kosher dairy breakfast lunch spot! Missing some basics like pancakes but the options we got were good. Would be great to have mimosas also

The place was amazing with amazing food to go with it

Amazing food, awesome food and excellent service - highly recommended!

The food is magnificent but be prepared to pay. The food looks great and it tastes amazing.

When she came back so told me that she already added the tip so we left.   While we were waiting for her car the waitress came out and basically asked us where was her tip! Name: Peet's Coffee
Address: 1854 Westwood Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90025, USA
Combined Review Text:
Haven

Stepping into Peet’s on Westwood Blvd feels like a warm hug in coffee form. The rich aroma of freshly brewed beans greets you, setting the tone for a delightful experience.

Brew-tiful Beverages

Whether you’re a fan of bold dark roasts or prefer a smooth latte, Peet’s has you covered. Their seasonal offerings, like the Honey Almond Latte, add a sweet twist to your caffeine fix.  ￼

Friendly Faces

The baristas here are not just skilled but genuinely friendly. They remember regulars and are always ready with a smile, making each visit feel personal.

Cozy Corner

The ambiance strikes a perfect balance between bustling and serene. It’s an ideal spot for catching up on work, reading, or simply enjoying your drink.

Final Sip

Peet’s Coffee on Westwood Blvd is more than just a coffee shop; it’s a community staple where quality brews meet quality people. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a reliable and pleasant coffee experience.

Love to Chris! He always has positive energy every time I see him. Super polite, kind and cheerful. He makes a great Vanilla Latte- perfect every time. I’m always happy to see him 💖

Very poor service and slow barista must be fast and efficient but these guys talk n talk takes them 5 minutes to get you cream for simple coffee. Must be trained again . The store in Montana are great and fast amazing

100% better then Starbucks

Tasty croissants, perfect coffee, best tea!
Thanks guys!!!

Best coffee on the planet. Peet's coffee shop was very comfortable. The staff are extremely friendly and super fast. The coffee is excellent, I had a latte and it was perfect. I really recommend Peet's, I don't have one near me so what a treat to be here.

Name: Philz Coffee

Matthew was incredible. I hope they are paying him well. Talent like this doesn't stick around. I will always think of him as Mr coffee. You're the best Matthew

Very nice staff, affordable prices, cozy cafe. I recommend 💯💯💯

The workers are so kind and nice, they always tell you to let them know if you need your drink adjusted. I’ve been to this location a couple times and it’s always a good time. Would recommend coming here to catch up with people or to do work for a short period of time

Name: Pico Cafe
Address: 8944 W Pico Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90035, USA
Combined Review Text:
I am a huge fan of this place. Although the menu is packed every item is made extremely well. The portions are generous and the food is very fresh and tasty.
The atmosphere is very laidback and not pretentious at all.
This is a family friendly location.
I highly recommend anyone who is looking for a nice casual place for breakfast brunch or lunch.
Two thumbs up!!

I found hair in my salad.
First time ever eating from a restaurant and having this happen. Extremely disappointed to say the least and beyond grossed out.

Food and service were great! Loved the breakfast special

Great good and service, not much going on in terms of ambiance. I’m very picky with my smoothies and they make them very well. The quesadillas are delicious too!

Simple and lovely setting with really delicious authentic food.  I relished each bite.

Name: Pompadour Beverly Hills
Address: 9466 Charleville Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
Combined Review Text:
This dessert shop may be small but they're big on taste and flavors! I unfortunately had the stomach for only one dessert, but everything looked so good. Decided to try the lavender cake and it was perfectly moist inside, not overly powerful in lavender, and great proportion of cream to cake. Definitely need to try the other desserts next time.

Best place for food on campus, only balanced by the fact that it's a ways uphill from most res halls. The breakfast and brunch menus don't include sandwiches, but do have bagel sandwiches which are almost as good. Also has a small prepackaged section if time is of the essence.

Name: Upside Down
Address: 10962 Le Conte Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90024, USA
Combined Review Text:
Super cute cafe! Donation based! No price set for any drink! You are immersed in the Bruins community and just simple kindness of strangers who offer a smile.
Such a warm and lovely place, just like the LA sunshine outside. Go get a coffee and grab a seat by the window, I bet your friends would envy your work setup!

Upside Down is a great coffee shop for relaxing, studying, or enjoying community events. They have incredible drinks, from delicious black coffee to an ever changing menu of seasonal drinks. The staff is friendly and excellently trained. The space has incredible local art and hosts gallery openings.

Their mocha is the best I’ve ever had. I always come here for it, and I really like the events they have, like unplug nights and challah bread making! It’s really focused on community and that comes through in their concept design. So happy UCLA has this place next door!

It’s a nice open spacious lounge area and is a way better deal and theory than Starbucks. The employees here are super friendly and make my day as I’m getting to know them. I stop by here regularly to say hi to the employees, hangout, and possibly get a drink. They even have a table with legos and puzzles which is a good way to cope with stress. The people I’ve met here such as Kara, Abigail, Alexa, and Rachel are amazing and make my day. They even remember me and they say my name. For those who want a coffee in Westwood, come to Upside Down and don’t bother going to Starbucks.

Rose latte & a banana pecan muffin. The latte with Rose was very delicious, slightly sweet with a very mild hint of rose but it tasted great! They have some cool lids too that let out a good amount of drink. Got it iced as recommended. The banana pecan muffin was awesome, very fluffy soft with delicious flavor. It was very busy when I went but they work fast. Parking available on the streets and some parking lots. Plenty if tables and seats inside. Prices are fair & staff was pleasant.

Name: Urth Caffe Beverly Hills
Address: 267 S Beverly Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, USA
Combined Review Text:
Great cafe for brunch or lunch. A nice place to meet up with friends. Delicious, fresh, healthy menu items. Fancy drinks. High quality food. There is a small indoor dining space, and much more outdoor space. Best for couples, but not large groups.

Visited for Sunday brunch and ordered a matcha latte, cappuccino, and the wild mushroom pizza. Unfortunately, they were out of pancakes which was a bit of a letdown—but the food we did get was absolutely delicious. We sat outdoors by the fire heater, which made the experience cozy and pleasant. As always, the place was bustling with energy and full of life - a lively spot that’s consistently a favorite.

WE LOVE URTH.

We’ve only had coffee and pastries. However, the food looks fresh and healthy.

The Churro Delight is my absolute favorite. My husband brings one home for me every trip.

We prefer the hot lattes over the iced ones here at urth.

Always busy but never had an issue with finding a seat.

We had breakfast/brunch with friends at Urth Caffe Beverly Hills and really enjoyed our experience. The staff was friendly and welcoming, and the service was fast and efficient. The food was delicious—fresh, flavorful, and nicely presented. It’s a great spot to relax and catch up with friends, especially on a weekend morning. Highly recommend it for anyone looking for a quality brunch in a vibrant, comfortable setting.

Had a great experience at Urth Caffé. I ordered the avocado pizza, which was nothing like I have had before. The ingredients tasted high quality, and the portion was just right. I sat outside next to the heaters, which made for a cozy and comfortable atmosphere. Even though it was busy, the service was friendly and efficient. Definitely a solid spot for a relaxed meal with good food and a nice ambiance.

Name: Verve Coffee Roasters
Address: 8925 Melrose Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA
Combined Review Text:
Good coffee and tea. Great environment. Spacious indoor, nice outdoor garden, and a nice front patio with a view of the street.

Great place for coffee lovers. Nice coffee, great food and excellent service ☕️👏

Great and vibrant place that opens very early!

We tried avocado on toast, it was very tasty but the bread was so hard to chew. We also had the breakfast sandwich, pain au chocolate and almond croissant which were all great.

The coffee tasted delicious too! Seating is uncomfortable.

Espresso here came recommended by a fellow espresso  aficionado. Like Vergano, Verve gets it, their espresso is top notch, the way they have it roasted. We really enjoyed our flat whites, as is, no sugar, no sweeteners, just amazing. Nice job, you-all knocked it out of the park!

Terrific pastries and rich chai lattes! I came here after walking past many times and boy was I happily surprised. The vibe here is very much social with the outdoor space being a bit more relaxed. The staff is very kind and attentive. The drinks and food are averagely priced, but the quality is absolutely great. Definitely plan to visit this shop again!

Name: WFM Coffee & Juice Bar

I don’t know what the point of this place is if you’re gonna have staff unapologetically not serve coffee at 8am lol, save yourself time in traffic and go to the myriad of other options in the area

Chocolate peanut buttery is amazing in whole food San Vincent.
Really like it
